newsitem.title: PERU: Lima stocks mixed as electric company dominates.
newsitem.headline: Lima stocks mixed as electric company dominates.

text.p: Lima shares closed mixed as newly-popular electricity company Luz del Sur continued to dominate trade, brokers said.
They forecast prices would stay flat or possibly dip slightly on Friday.
On Thursday, the General Index rose 0.03 percent to 1,396.12 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index was off 0.03 percent to 1,900.29.
Total volume picked up to 43.2 million soles ($17.5 million), as 27 stocks fell, 25 rose and 33 were stable.
Brokers said there were signs of a return of foreign investors to the market during Thursday's session.
Luz del Sur accounted for 16.83 percent of trade, but ended off 1.64 percent to 3.60 soles on two million shares.
Breweries also drew interest, with Cervesur up 4.67 percent to 1.57 soles on 211,820 shares and brewery Backus y Johnston falling 0.41 percent to 2.41 soles on more than three million shares.
Benchmark Telefonica del Peru dipped 0.36 percent to 5.48 soles on 1.3 million shares, or 15.68 percent of trading volume.
